p: Mammalian Golgi is the main producer of SL: SM, GlcCer, lactosylceramide (LacCer) and higher-order GSLs, whose final destination is the PM [ 33]. For SL production in the lumen of the trans-Golgi, Cer issued by the ER is required [ 34]. Later on, SL will accumulate in the PM whereas SL levels in the ER will be low. As it happens with SL, sterols are scarce in the ER, representing only 5 mol% of lipids, in contrast to the trans-Golgi and PM where sterols are abundant (30 mol%â€“40 mol%) [ 16, 35]. Sterols favorably interact with lipids containing large head groups and saturated fatty acyl chains, as is the case for SL [ 36].
